message: Hi, I need to change my name on my driving license.
How can I assist you with changing your name on your license?
need to update my last name.
So what do I need to do?
To change your name on your driving license,
you'll need to send us your old license along with the D1 application form for car/motorcycle licenses...
You can get those forms at most Post Offices.
What else do I need to send?
Along with the completed D1 form
you'll need to include original documents confirming your new name, like a marriage certificate.
I seem to have misplaced my old license. I can't find it anywhere.
No worries, you can still apply if your old license is lost or stolen.
Okay, what do I need to do then?
When you fill out the D1 form,
just explain that it's been misplaced and include a £20 fee payable to DVLA.
I have to pay £20 just because I lost my license? That's ridiculous!
Yes there is a £20 fee if you cannot send in your old license when applying for a new one with a name change.
That's absurd. I'm already having to go through the hassle of changing my name on everything,
and now you're charging me for losing a little plastic card?
The £20 fee helps cover the administrative costs of issuing a new license without the old one being returned.
It's not just arbitrary, those are the rules set by DVLA.
I understand it's frustrating, but I have to follow their policies.
Ugh, fine. So to summarize - I need to fill out the D1 form,
include documentation proving my new name like a marriage certificate, and send a £20 cheque since I lost my old license. Is that correct?
Yes, that's correct. Fill out the D1 form,
include your original marriage certificate or other name change documents, and a £20 cheque or postal order payable to DVLA since you cannot send in your old license.
Thanks for clarifying, even if I don't agree with the fee.
I understand your frustration with the fee, but I have to follow DVLA's policies.
Let me know if you need any other assistance.
